page.title: 04The Wheel Craft Centre -2-
page.content: The Mill and Craft Centre are owned by one person but each of the 16 craft units is autononymous and operated by the craftsperson in residence. The public has access all year round to the crafts workshops and there is no entrance fee. A shop sells a representative sample of the crafts produced by the blacksmith, shoemaker, furniture-maker, silversmith, stoneware potters, toymaker, ceramic modeller, mobile maker, print and textile designer, weaver, dress designer and stained glass maker. We interviewed two Australian potters who have been in the craftsworkshop for a year and plan to stay indefinitely. They enjoy the opportunity to meet the public in their workshop and are pleased that the craft centre is on a small scale and that they are able to work in such a pleasant atmosphere.
